Title: Provides for issuance of order of protection in criminal cases when defendant is found not responsible by reason of mental disease or defect
Summary: Provides for the issuance of orders of protection in family offense cases when defendant is found not responsible by reason of mental disease or defect, and the court issues an order of conditions in conjunction with such finding; such order of protection shall run concurrent with the order of conditions and any extensions thereof; also authorizes the issuance of a family offense order of protection in conjunction with an order of observation pursuant to article 730 of the criminal procedure law; such order shall have a term not to exceed three years following the final or temporary order of observation or from the release from the custody of the commissioner of mental health.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to the issuance of orders of protection
